page.title: 20A DAY IN JANINE KERBY'S LIFE
page.content: I get up at 7 a.m. have a wash and get dressed. For my breakfast I have toast and a cup of tea. I brush my hair, get my bag and walk to school. We have to be there for 9 a.m. We read and do individual study. At playtime I play with my friends; we enjoy fairy tales and skipping. When we go in we do maths. At noon the children with packed lunches go out to play whilst other children eat school dinners. My favourite meal is roast potatoes, roast beef, Yorkshire Pudding and cabbage followed by jelly whip. After dinner I go out to play. At 1.15 p.m. we do English, have assembly, games or sewing. At 3.30 p.m. we go home. I help my mum to cook the tea. We have a hot meal in the kitchen and then go into the room to watch "Crossroads", "Coronation Street" or "Brookside" on television. At 8.30 p.m. I go to bed.
